### ğŸ§  Neurodivergent Impact Assessment
<!-- How does this change affect neurodivergent users? -->

**Positive Impacts:**
- [ ] **Reduces Cognitive Load**: Makes code easier to process
- [ ] **Improves Pattern Recognition**: Better visual/structural clarity
- [ ] **Enhances Focus**: Reduces mental overhead
- [ ] **Better Memory Support**: Aids code comprehension/retention

- [ ] **Processing Speed**: Faster understanding/reasoning
- [ ] **AI Compatibility**: Better AI model understanding
- [ ] **None**: No specific neurodivergent impact

**Potential Concerns:**
- [ ] **Increases Complexity**: May be harder to understand
- [ ] **Breaks Patterns**: Changes familiar structures
- [ ] **Adds Cognitive Load**: More to remember/process
- [ ] **Sensory Issues**: May affect visual/auditory processing
- [ ] **None**: No concerns identified

### ğŸ“‹ Checklist
<!-- Review this checklist before submitting -->

**Code Quality:**
- [ ] Code follows HyperCode style guidelines
- [ ] Self-documenting code with clear variable names
- [ ] Comments explain "why" not "what"
- [ ] No TODO/FIXME comments left in final code
- [ ] Error handling is comprehensive and clear

**Documentation:**
- [ ] README updated (if needed)
- [ ] API docs updated (if applicable)
- [ ] Inline documentation added
- [ ] Examples updated (if needed)
- [ ] Migration guide (if breaking change)

**Accessibility:**
- [ ] Neurodivergent-friendly design
- [ ] Screen reader compatible
- [ ] Color contrast compliant
- [ ] Keyboard navigation tested
- [ ] Cognitive load considered

**Performance:**
- [ ] No performance regressions
- [ ] Memory usage acceptable
- [ ] Startup time acceptable
- [ ] Scalability considered

## ğŸ¤ Review Guidelines for Maintainers

### ğŸ§  Neurodivergent-Friendly Review
- Focus on technical correctness, not communication style
- Assume good intentions and technical competence
- Be direct and specific in feedback
- Allow for different processing speeds
- Appreciate diverse problem-solving approaches

### ğŸŒ Accessibility Review
- Verify neurodivergent-friendly design
- Check screen reader compatibility
- Validate color contrast
- Test keyboard navigation
- Assess cognitive load impact

### ğŸ”§ Technical Review
- Code quality and maintainability
- Performance implications
- Security considerations
- Test coverage adequacy
- Documentation completeness
